greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Sum_{k>=0} 1/(k^2+1).
comment: Known to be transcendental. After n=2 it is the same as A100554(n).
Imaginary part of psi(I) (for the real part, see A248177). - _Stanislav Sykora_, Oct 03 2014
reference: Michel Waldschmidt, Elliptic functions and transcendance, Surveys in number theory, 143-188, Dev. Math., 17, Springer, New York, 2008.
link: Ivan Panchenko, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
xref: Essentially the same as A100554 and A259171.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jan 07 2006
ext: Offset changed from 0 to 1 by _Bruno Berselli_, Dec 02 2013
